items.title: 5 possible MLB landing spots for Ohtani
items.summary: Shohei Ohtani will ask the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters to post him to Major League Baseball teams this offseason, according to Japanese media reports. The Fighters are expected to accede to those wishes.
items.content: Shohei Ohtani will ask the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters to post him to Major League Baseball teams this offseason, according to Japanese media reports. The Fighters are expected to accede to those wishes.

alternate.title: 5 possible MLB landing spots for Ohtani

items.title: Indians activate Miller from disabled list
items.summary: The Indians have been on some kind of high lately. Entering their series opener against the Royals on Thursday at Progressive Field, the Tribe sits atop the American League at 90-56 and has rattled off an AL-record 21 straight victories. Just when things couldn't seem to get much better for the Indians, they activated relief ace Andrew Miller from the disabled list.
items.content: The Indians have been on some kind of high lately. Entering their series opener against the Royals on Thursday at Progressive Field, the Tribe sits atop the American League at 90-56 and has rattled off an AL-record 21 straight victories. Just when things couldn't seem to get much better for the Indians, they activated relief ace Andrew Miller from the disabled list.

alternate.title: Indians activate Miller from disabled list

items.title: Waino, Fowler among Cards close to returning
items.summary: Though the Cardinals did not take batting practice before Thursday's series finale against the Reds, Busch Stadium was buzzing with on-field activity. Several rehabbing players, including Adam Wainwright and Dexter Fowler, went out early for work that pushed them closer to a return.
items.content: Though the Cardinals did not take batting practice before Thursday's series finale against the Reds, Busch Stadium was buzzing with on-field activity. Several rehabbing players, including Adam Wainwright and Dexter Fowler, went out early for work that pushed them closer to a return.

alternate.title: Waino, Fowler among Cards close to returning

items.title: Joe Blogs: The 1916 Giants winning streak
items.summary: I love that the Indians' 21-game winning streak gets us to talk about the all-time record 26-game streak of the 1916 Giants. That the Giants record is on the books is exactly as it should be -- just like Cy Young's 511 wins and Ed Walsh's 1.82 career ERA and Ty Cobb's .367 batting average. But let's not kid ourselves. They are not at all the same thing.
items.content: I love that the Indians' 21-game winning streak gets us to talk about the all-time record 26-game streak of the 1916 Giants. That the Giants record is on the books is exactly as it should be -- just like Cy Young's 511 wins and Ed Walsh's 1.82 career ERA and Ty Cobb's .367 batting average. But let's not kid ourselves. They are not at all the same thing.

alternate.title: Joe Blogs: The 1916 Giants winning streak
